numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a significant gap between the legacy boost and the estimated advantage without the legacy boost.
2. The graph shows an effect even without the legacy boost.
3. If a student is in the 99.9 percentile of the parents' income rank then the student is about 3 times more likely to be accepted into an IV school.
4. I wonder if some students have an issue with this situation.
5. I wonder if some students feel that they got into these schools because of their parents.
6. If I were such a student then I would feel that I did not deserve to be there.
7. If I were such a student then I would want to get into the school on my own.
8. I wonder if some parents notice this situation.
9. I wonder if some parents begin to do something about this situation.
10. I wonder if some parents do not care enough about this situation.
11. This topic relates to me.
12. I will apply to colleges soon.
13. I think that it is interesting to learn more about statistics.
14. My community is middle-upper class.
15. I think that this fact diminishes our chances of getting into an IV league school.
16. I think that it is frustrating that income is a factor in college acceptance.
17. I think that college acceptance should depend on education level.
18. I think that college acceptance should depend on other things.
19. I think that college acceptance should not depend on parents' income.
20. The headline is: What do colleges really think about when looking at applications?
21. The headline also is: Is it rigged?
